subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
author: Rj
full_text:
--0-1686185686-1244492771=:9194
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

You are confusing the oscillation frequency (vibration) of the air and our =
ear drums, with the  oscillation frequency of electromagnetic energy.=A0 

=
For example, we can hear sound waves between around  40 Hz at the lower end=
 to about 16,000 Hz at the higher end.=A0 These are sound pressure waves.

=
In the EM spectrum. some of those regions are covered by radio VLF (3000 Hz=
 to 30,000 hz), and ULF (300 Hz, to 3000hz). These are radio frequencies, a=
nd you can't hear them: they are electromagnetic energy, traveling in photo=
ns (yes, it is valid to call non-visible EM energy a photon).=A0 


--- On =
Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@...> wrote:

From: Frank Ratka=
 <warrior18eii@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yaho=
ogroups.com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:05 PM











    
           =
 
            


      
      Tell me where the seperation on the spectrum =
takes place between 300Hz and 300KHz. Yes, soundwaves cause pressure waves =
that our ears read as vibration and our mind translates as sound. The waves=
 are still on the electromagnetic spectrum. Even subsonic geomagnetic waves=
 are present on the scale. What I mean by power can be directll translated =
to volume or amplitude. The only thing that distinguishes soundwaves from a=
ny other wave is the fact that we can hear them.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, =
6/8/09, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


From: Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com>
Su=
bject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, J=
une 8, 2009, 2:53 PM








No. Sounds waves are not on the electromagnet =
spectrum nor are they a form of electromagnet energy. Sound waves are based=
 on pressure waves in the air (or in other substances).=A0 Our ears detect =
these pressure waves and translate them into sounds we here.=A0 Our ear do =
NOT hear electromagnet energy.=A0 Our eyes do: that part which we call visi=
ble light.



--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com> wro=
te:


From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ne=
w ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 12:38 PM

=








It sounds like she's saying "one, two, ....."
=A0
A mistake that a =
lot of people make is thinking that there are two different types of energy=
 at work when it comes to sound waves and electromagnetic waves. The only t=
hing that seperates them is frequency and power. Radio waves are radio wave=
s because they occupy a certain block of the electromagnietic spectrum. Sou=
nd waves exist on that same spectrum just farther down with much longer wav=
es. Soundwaves and subsonic waves can penetrate almost anything because of =
their wavelengths. The shorter the wavelength the more ways we can shield a=
gainst them.
=A0
Think of microwaves. These are also a type of radio and te=
lemetry transmitting wave but the waves also have a physical effect on our =
environment by causing molecules to speed up, which creates heat. A little =
lower than this is IR or infrared it too can cause physical objects to heat=
 up but usually it just causes molecules to rotate in place. All physical t=
hings give off IR light. Its a way the total system conserves energy by spo=
ntaneously emitting IR radiation.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, April A=
bercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


From: April Aber=
crombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New i=
deas [3 Attachments]
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 200=
9, 2:27 PM





Here is some food for thought. I am currently reviewing my =
audio from our May 30th investigation.
=A0
It was me and another girl teamm=
ate=A0present in the room. I picked up a 3rd female voice on my digital voi=
ce recorder that I carry with me. We were standing right next to another di=
gital video recorder that I leave beside my night vision camera. That recor=
der did not pick up this 3rd voice. I have asked the girl that was with me =
to check her recording to see if she picked it up.
=A0
I have long felt the=
 true EVP does not come from sound waves in the environment, or then it wou=
ldn't be EVP, but a disembodied voice. Somehow EVP's are appearing directly=
 on the recordings.
=A0
This instance with the recorders may back that theo=
ry up. That other recorder should have picked that voice up if it were soun=
d waves in the environment.
=A0
I am attaching the clip of this 3rd voice. =
The=A0file that is named=A0"01-02-17 Clip" is the full clip.=A0You will hea=
r my voice as I say "Yeah", and then another comes in right after that. I t=
hink I know what it says.
=A0
Again, I was live monitoring my audio, but st=
ill did not hear this until playback. It isn't clear, so I am not as excite=
d about it as my one's from the last investigation.
=A0
=A0

----- Original=
 Message ----- 
From: Frank Ratka 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent: Mond=
ay, June 08, 2009 1:09 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas








I have a=
 running theory that EVP is carried on an untrasonic wave and demodulated e=
xactly where they want it to manifest. It works off the heterodyne principl=
e. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that differ one another in frequency the=
n if you add or subtract them together you get a beat frequency or alternat=
e frequency. For example, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and you h=
ave an electric fan in a room creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz the=
n you will have a intermediate difference=A0frequency at 9KHz, well within =
human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all elec=
tronic equipment generates ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. From=
 this theory I always felt that EVP were generated within a few inches of t=
he recorder.
=A0
We are able to reproduce this affect in not only radio wit=
h superheterodyne systems but also with acoustics and audio as in some pass=
ive sonars and a commercial produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Jos=
eph Pompeii.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail.=
 com> wrote:


From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-IT=
C] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:56 =
PM





Fascinating! I've had this idea that the EVP are often=A0not record=
ed by the microphone but somehow make their way in at the actual=A0point wh=
ere the storage is made, whether it be analog (tape) or digital.=A0

So muc=
h we don't know ...
=A0
Zack

=A0
On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, April Abe=
rcrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:









I monitor m=
y audio live. The funny thing is that even so, those last EVP's I captured =
I did not hear either in the environment, or on my recording as it happened=
. I only heard them upon playback.
=A0


----- Original Message ----- 
From=
: Zack Widup 

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 



Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009=
 11:40 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas




I am curious if anyone with =
a microphone wired to a remote site has ever gotten any EVP in real time.
=
=A0
I=A0took part in=A0an investigation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL=
, on Saturday night. We had six video cameras set up in the three halls of =
the building. The video for all=A0was being monitored and recorded=A0at a c=
entral location. Alas, we did not have microphones at the camera sites cone=
cted to the central location. I wonder what we might have heard if we did?
=
=A0
Zack

=A0
On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 12:05 PM, threadsintyme@ juno.com <Thr=
eadsintyme@ juno.com> wrote:

=A0
Let's just agree to end this discussion a=
bout her... 
Why don't we discuss something on a lighter note? Anyone have =
any new ideas about either evp or ITC? 
Al












      
 

      

  =

<div>I have a running theory that EVP is carried on an untrason=
ic wave and demodulated exactly where they want it to manifest. It works of=
f the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that differ one=
 another in frequency then if you add or subtract them together you get a b=
eat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if a ghost is sending a =
signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room creating an untrason=
ic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate difference fre=
quency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was j=
ust an example, but all electronic equipment generates ultrasonic signals j=
ust by turning them on. From this theory I always felt that EVP were genera=
ted within a few inches of the recorder.</div>
<div> </div>
<div>We ar=
e able to reproduce this affect in not only radio with superheterodyne syst=
ems but also with acoustics and audio as in some passive sonars and a comme=
rcial produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.</div>
<di=
v> </div>

<div>Fascinating! I've had this idea tha=
t the EVP are often not recorded by the microphone but somehow make th=
eir way in at the actual point where the storage is made, whether it b=
e analog (tape) or digital. <br></div>
<div>So much we don't know ...<=
/div>
